title: Does science say the universe is made up of consciousness? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Science says that the universe is made of energy, and energy comes in the form of matter (such as electrons, quarks, and atoms) and radiation (such as photons and gluons). Consciousness is a phenomenon that arises from these constituents. Most forms of matter and radiation (stars, for example) appear to have no consciousness, but some forms (such as humans and many other animals) do appear to have consciousness.

Does science say the universe is made up of consciousness? This question invites confusion… this articles says why: On A Distinction Between Access and Phenomenal Consciousness. Does science say the universe is made up of access consciousness? — this would clearly be an absurd question. Does science say the universe is made up of phenomenal consciousness? — since p-consciousness is entirely non-empirical science cannot gain any traction upon it, so science says nothing about it.

Does science say the universe is made up of consciousness? Science can’t say this as it’s a statement that’s outside the remit of science. Any scientist who claims that the universe is made up of matter - or alternatively that it is made up of consciousness - is not making a scientific statement. Rather they are making a philosophical statement. Only philosophy can make a statement of this kind…

No. But there are a few scientists who believe this, some pretty smart guys too. Who knows there may someday be evidence for this, but right now we know very little about consciousness at all. It is still the greatest mystery in science.

Science generally says that Universe is made up of matter and energy, which are inter-convertible. According to me, Consciousness is a form of energy, produced in biological beings. There seems no point in mixing up the two separate specific terms for each other in general terminology.
